label: Ku-guyur seluruh tubuh-ku dengan air dari keran wudu.
trs: I poured water on my body with water from the wudu tap.’\footnote{Kran wudu is the tap Muslims use to get water from to wash their face, hands, and feet in preparation for prayer.}    (Kumalasari2006: 12)

label: Mereka me-ngurung-nya di dalam sel, meng-ganti pakaian-nya dengan seragam hitam bau kapur barus dan lemari kayu, me-ringkuk di satu dipan meng-hadap-i susu hangat yang tak di-cecap-nya, meng-hadap-i sepiring nasi ikan tongkol yang tak di-lumat-nya.
trs: Theyi put him{j} in a cell, [ ]i changed his{j} clothes into a black uniform smelling of mothballs and wooden wardrobe, [ ]j curled up on a wooden bed [ ]j facing (a glass of) warm milk he{j} didn’t drink, [ ]j facing a plate of tuna rice he{j} didn’t devour.’   ([37]{Kurniawan2004}; my translation)

label: Sepasang suami istri yang sedang pergi ke tahlilan keluarga di Cirebon di-serang oleh geng motor.
trs: A husband and wife, who went to a family tahlilan event in Cirebon, were attacked by a motorcycle gang.’\footnote{Tahlilan is a Muslim social gathering to commemorate the dead. Pak is a short form of bapak, a kin term used to address or refer to one’s father and adult males in general.}  (\citetitle{FokusPagi}, Indosiar, 9/11/2015)

label: Tiba-tiba Novel di-datang-i dua orang bersepeda motor dan langsung me-nyiram-nya dengan air keras. Novel lalu berteriak dengan sekencang-kencangnya.
trs: Suddenly Noveli was approached by two peoplej on a motorbike and  {[ ]}j threw acid on himi. Novel screamed as loudly as he could.’ (\citetitle{Eksklusif}, Aiman, Kompas TV, 3 July 2017)

label: Almashirai mem-buka gorden biru muda bermotif vineyard, me-natap-i tetes hujan deras yang mem-basah-i jendela kamar-nya yang ter-letak di tempat yang paling private di rumah-nya, alias di loteng. Di-ambil-nyai sweter-nyaj yang gombrong dan nyaman, lalu me-makai-kan-nyaj di tubuh-nya yang langsing.
trs: Almashirai opened the light blue curtain with a vineyard motif, stared at the raindrops falling on the window of her bedroom which is located in the most private section of her house, namely upstairs. Shei grabbed her loose and comfortable sweaterj, and put itj on her slim body.’ (Karina2008: 7)

label: Rosna me-langkah ke dalam, mem-buka pintu tengah, lalu pergi menuju kamar mandi setelah ia meng-ambil handuk yang ter-gantung di sampiran. Di-cuci-nya muka-nya, kemudian di-lap-nya kering-kering, lalu kembali ke kamar-nya.
trs: Rosna stepped inside, opened the door in the middle (of the room), and then headed towards the bathroom after she fetched a towel that was hanging on the rail. She washed her facei, then she wiped  j dry, after which  i returned to her room.’   (Krisna1977: 119)

label: Cowok berparas kutu buku ini tertegun me-lihat salah.satu potongan gambar yang terasa begitu familiar di ingatan-nya. Perlahan di-pungut-nyai ujung kertas itu, me-natap-i-nyaj lama dengan berbagai luapan emosi bermain di refleksi mata-nya yang nanar.
trs: This guy with the bookish face was stunned (at) seeing a piece of a picture which felt so familiar in his memory. Slowly he picked up the corner of the paper,   stared at it for a long time with all sorts of emotions reflecting in his wild eyes.’   (Karina2008: 9)

label: Ia telah me-ngemas semua barang-barang-nya, dengan harapan jika ia pergi me-ninggalkan-nya, semua dalam keadaan rapi. Buku-buku yang semula berserakan di atas tempat tidur, meja dan lantai ia masukkan ke dalam kotak kardus dan me-numpuk-nya rapi di sudut kamar.
trs: He has packed up all his belongings, with the hope that if he has to go away leaving them behind, all would be in a neat condition. He put the books which were lying on the bed, table and floor in cardboard boxes and   stacked them up neatly in the corner of the room.’ (Kurniawan2002: 195--196)
